channel.description: Recent content in Blog on matkv

item.title: Changing how I'm doing book reviews
item.description: I haven’t really been keeping up with writing reviews for the books I read on here. The last review I did immediately after finishing the book was book 4 of The Wheel of Time and now I’m already at book 13.

item.title: Advent of Code & laziness
item.description: This year I tried to participate in Advent of Code again. As every year, I start out motivated - this time I wanted to use AoC as an opportunity to use Go more and get to know the language better - and as every year, I lost motivation within a couple of days and have now basically stopped participating at all. Overall I really like the idea of AOC, especially how many devs from all around the world participate in it.

item.title: On writing more regularly
item.description: I’m trying to write blog entries here more regularly - so I’m doing just that.

item.title: My Neovim in VSCode setup
item.description: My last update about Neovim, I swear :D

item.title: My Obsidian / TeuxDeux / Omnivore setup
item.description: A quick overview of what I’m using as my personal knowledge base and to-do list.

item.title: 2 year website anniversary
item.description: I just noticed that it has been two years (8th of October 2021) since I’ve set up this website. Feels like that’s worth a post.

item.title: Focusing on Go
item.description: After messing around with Rust for quite a while, I’ve decided to put that on hold for the near future at least & shift my focus (back) to learning Go.

item.title: Downgrading Neovim to a simple text editor again
item.description: Why I’ve decided to give up on trying to use Neovim as my main IDE and how I’m planning to use it in the future instead.

item.title: The Wheel of Time - status update
item.description: I started reading The Wheel of Time in June 2021. Since then I’ve been on the journey of going through this book series - so here is a short status update on my current progress.

item.title: What I want to focus on
item.description: I’ve once again kind of lost track of what I want to focus on when it comes to my hobbies and learning new things. This post is supposed to help me get a better overview of my goals & focus in the nearby future.

item.title: code.matkv.dev
item.description: I just set up a second site that I’m planning to use for random programming projects. It runs on Blazor and can be found at code.matkv.dev

item.title: One last Neovim experiment
item.description: After playing around with multiple editors over the last couple of years and eventually settling on Helix, I’m giving Neovim one last try using NvChad.

item.title: Reviving this blog
item.description: I haven’t been active on this blog for more than 8 months. I’m trying to change that now, so here are some ideas on what direction I want to take this blog in the future and what kind of content I want to focus on.

item.title: Managing dotfiles
item.description: I finally got around to setting up a way to manage my dotfiles - using a Git bare repository. This blog post a tutorial for future reference in order to be able to replicate this setup on a different computer.

item.title: On Digital Minimalism
item.description: Some thoughts on Digital Minimalism and my plans on how I am going to try to (hopefully) embrace this mindset a bit more in my personal life and be more mindful about my technology use.

item.title: Giving Doom Emacs a second try
item.description: After trying out Doom Emacs late last year and giving up on it, I’ve decided to give it another try.

item.title: Trying out Obsidian
item.description: I’ve been interested in personal knowledge base systems recently. After reading about several different ones, I’ve decided to give Obsidian a shot & try moving all my existing notes there & set up an Obsidian vault from scratch.

item.title: My chess progress
item.description: So far this blog has been mostly just about updates on this website but kind of want to also write about other topics. So I thought I’d write a recap on my chess progress over the last year and how I’m planning to work on improving my chess in the future.

item.title: Changed my domain
item.description: I changed the domain for this website! It can now be reached at matkv.dev. Previously it was my full name + “.com” but I decided to change it because I feel more comfortable sharing this domain on various sites without having to actually reveal my full name.

item.title: Added notes feature to this website
item.description: I can now easily create notes & pages that don’t really fit into any of the other categories on this website! For now, I’ve added a page for programming projects ideas, new usecases for my Raspberry Pi and ideas for new content for this website!

item.title: Project ideas for my Raspberry Pi
item.description: Now that my old Raspberry Pi isn’t used anymore as a 24/7 torrent box for my … Linux ISOs, here are some ideas about what I could use for now.

item.title: Mark active menu bold in Hugo
item.description: A quick summary of how I managed to set the currently active menu item bold on this website. My solution is a bit hacky but it works.

item.title: Current projects
item.description: I’ve been struggling to find a programming side project that I am really passionate about. In the last couple of weeks my main two projects have been this website & learning Rust. I did finish my little Rust project that plays a sound to wake up my studio monitor speakers, but apart from that I just keep abandoning all the side projects I start.

item.title: My current Rust progress
item.description: I started learning Rust back in December 2021. Here is a quick summary of my current progress at learning Rust.

item.title: Reading page and archetype
item.description: I’m exhausted but I managed to set up a page for my book reviews / reading list! I actually wrote a little C# program to automatically convert the exported csv from Goodreads into Markdown files that have the exact format that I need for this website.

item.title: Website redesign
item.description: I just finished the first version of a complete redesign of this website! This time I completely wrote all of the css from scratch and I set up the hugo site without a specific theme. I have a lot of changes planned but for now I’m really happy with this early version of the site.

item.title: Starting my Rust journey
item.description: After struggling to find ideas for side projects & not really being motivated about any of my current pet projects I have decided to try learning Rust.

item.title: Trying Doom Emacs
item.description: After trying out NeoVim and LunarVim, I’ve decided to also give Doom Emacs a try. I’m still unsure which editor fits my needs best so I’ll just play around with all of them to help me build an opinion.

item.title: Custom blog type
item.description: There is a custom blog type for this website now - this means it is possible to create a blog post with just one command. The date, the type and the layout will be automatically set and I can basically just start typing the actual post.

item.title: Switching to Lunarvim
item.description: I decided to give up on trying to get a productive NeoVim config set up anytime soon - I will instead try out LunarVim.

item.title: Neovim setup
item.description:
I decided to try out Neovim so I will use this blog post to document the setup process.

My main goals are:

  • Automate the setup process as much as possible so that I can easily reuse my configuration on a different computer.
  • Setup an built-in file browser and a nice theme (maybe the palenight theme)
  • Setup code completion for my most used languages, maybe try C# first

item.title: Custom project type
item.description: I just finally finished creating a custom type for projects. I’ll quickly document what I did so that I don’t forget it again.

item.title: First post
item.description: This is my first blog post. I am not sure what exactly I will be using this blog for, but for now my main goal is to improve the design and functionality of this website. This is also my first time setting up a custom domain so I am just learning and trying out stuff.
